pr_title: Fix upgrade from 0.19 when Kafka version is not specified in the CRD

timeline.message:
Fix upgrade from 0.19 when Kafka version is not specified in the CRD - Closes #3685

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

Fix NPE on new clusters when the version is not known yet

Signed-off-by: Jakub Scholz <www@scholzj.com>

timeline.author: im-konge

timeline.bodyText: I think that we can remove this, as we are not checking this anywhere.
timeline.author: im-konge

timeline.bodyText:
Do we want to use a boolean argument here, I wonder if it would be better to have two separate methods:
kafkaVersionChange

and
kafkaVersionChangePostponed
timeline.author: samuel-hawker
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -280,7 +280,8 @@ public KafkaAssemblyOperator(Vertx vertx, PlatformFeaturesAvailability pfa,
                 .compose(state -> state.kafkaManualPodCleaning())
                 .compose(state -> state.kafkaNetPolicy())
                 .compose(state -> state.kafkaManualRollingUpdate())
-                .compose(state -> state.kafkaVersionChange())
+                .compose(state -> state.kafkaVersionChangeCheck())
+                .compose(state -> state.kafkaVersionChange(false))

replies.bodyText: The methods are otherwise almost the same. So is it really worth to have separate methods duplicating the code? Or would you just want to have methods which simply delegate to the shared method again?
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: I was thinking through this as I was reading through the method, it would be nice if they could be split, with the duplicated logic being moved out to separate methods, I started refactoring it locally and realized to rip out the boolean would be a non-trivial effort for not enough value. I thought it was worth bringing up, as boolean arguments normally can be extracted, but in this case it wouldn't be worth it.
replies.author: samuel-hawker
